Context:
Program Name: Pre-Health Sciences Pathway to Advanced Diplomas and Degrees (A108)
Credential: Ontario College Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 1 year (2 semesters)
Starting Months: January, May, September
Domestic Tuition: $3,926.00
International Tuition: $17,974.00
Location: St. James Campus
Program Availability:
- Fall 2024: Open for both domestic and international students
- Winter 2025: Open for both domestic and international students (opens Apr 8, 2024)
- Spring 2025: Open for both domestic and international students (opens Aug 6, 2024)
Program Description: A one-year certificate program that prepares students to apply to St. George's University in Grenada, West Indies for Doctor of Medicine (MD) programs. Students will fulfill science requirements through (A108) courses.
Note: For applicants aiming to meet admission prerequisites for one-year certificate or two-year diploma health sciences programs, apply to the Pre-Health Sciences Pathway to Certificates and Diplomas (A109) program instead.

Context:
The Pre-Health Sciences Pathway to Advanced Diplomas and Degrees (A108) is a one-year certificate program offered at George Brown College. It prepares students for admission into advanced diploma or degree-level programs, both within George Brown and with partner institutions. Classes are held Monday to Friday from 8 AM to 6 PM and cover subjects such as communication, mathematics, human anatomy, biology, physics, organic/inorganic chemistry, advanced level English, and elective courses.

Graduates of this program can apply to various advanced diploma programs at George Brown College including Dental Hygiene (S134), Dental Technology (S100), Denturism (S101), and Hearing Instrument Specialist (S117). Additionally, graduates are eligible to apply to degree programs such as the Bachelor of Health Sciences at Queen's University (BHSc) or Trent University's various Bachelor of Sciences degrees, excluding Bachelor of Science - Nursing.

Graduates of this program can also apply to the Bachelor of Science in Nursing program at Brock University – Honours Bachelor of Science in Nursing.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Pre-Health Sciences Pathway to Advanced Diplomas and Degrees Program A108 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The following Ontario colleges offer a Bachelor of Science in Nursing degree: Brock University, Humber College, Laurentian University, McMaster University, Seneca College, Trent University/Fleming College, and Western University/Fanshawe College.

Graduates with a previous degree in any field from George Brown College's (A108) program can apply to the Doctor of Medicine (MD) program at St. George’s University in Grenada, West Indies. The science requirement for this program will be fulfilled by completing courses at George Brown College.

Required courses for the health sciences pathway at George Brown College include:
- Semester 1: BIOL 1052 (Biology for Health Sciences I), CHEM 1022 (Chemistry for Health Sciences I), COMM 2000 (Communicating Across Contexts), MATH 1143 (Mathematics for Health Sciences I), PHY 1014 (Physics for Health Sciences I), PREP 1012 (Personal and Professional Development), and COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication).
- Semester 2: BIOL 1062 (Biology for Health Sciences II), CHEM 1032 (Chemistry for Health Sciences II), PREP 1025 (Speaking With Confidence), MATH 1153 (Mathematics for Health Sciences II), COMM 1180 (Writing and Critical Thinking for Health Sciences), and PHY 1024 (Physics for Health Sciences II). A General Education Elective (GNED) also needs to be chosen.

Applicants interested in pursuing a one-year certificate or two-year college diploma health sciences program should apply to George Brown’s Pre-Health Sciences Pathway to Certificates and Diplomas (A109) program instead.

Context:

Context: Applicants require an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, with a grade 12C English (65 per cent or higher) or grade 12U English, and grade 12 math (C or U) (65 per cent or higher). Senior level biology, chemistry or physics are recommended. Mature students (19 years of age or older and no OSSD) may take the Admissions Assessment for English and Math, or consider upgrading to achieve the credits needed in English and math. Students who do not meet all A108 program requirements should consider applying to the A109 Pre-Health Science Pathways to Certificates and Diplomas program. College or university credits may qualify for course exemptions. International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System and can contact international recruitment representatives by country of origin. The text includes several contacts: [preparation@georgebrown.ca](mailto:preparation@georgebrown.ca), 416-415-5000, ext. 2874 and various international contact pages.
